title: Job 39:1
text: KNOWEST thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth?  or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

title: Job 39:2
text: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil?  or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

title: Job 39:3
text: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

title: Job 39:4
text: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.

title: Job 39:5
text: Who hath sent out the wild ass free?  or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

title: Job 39:6
text: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

title: Job 39:7
text: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

title: Job 39:8
text: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

title: Job 39:9
text: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?

title: Job 39:10
text: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow?  or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

title: Job 39:11
text: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great?  or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

title: Job 39:12
text: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?

title: Job 39:13
text: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks?  or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?

title: Job 39:14
text: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

title: Job 39:15
text: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

title: Job 39:16
text: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;

title: Job 39:17
text: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

title: Job 39:18
text: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

title: Job 39:19
text: Hast thou given the horse strength?  hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?

title: Job 39:20
text: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper?  the glory of his nostrils is terrible.

title: Job 39:21
text: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

title: Job 39:22
text: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

title: Job 39:23
text: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

title: Job 39:24
text: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.

title: Job 39:25
text: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

title: Job 39:26
text: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

title: Job 39:27
text: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

title: Job 39:28
text: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

title: Job 39:29
text: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

title: Job 39:30
text: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
